medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant abdominal pain and nausea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began suddenly while the patient was lying in bed, occurring at least 3 times in the past 2 weeks. The pain is described as pressure localized to the right upper quadrant, with no alleviating or aggravating factors. Pain has subsided previously but did not subside the night of the ED visit.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Migraine headaches, hemorrhoids with anal fissure, pituitary microadenoma/hyperprolactinemia, kidney stones, hyperlipidemia, saphenous vein narrowing.
